name: Finland Chamber of Commerce (Keskuskauppakamari)
membership: Finland Chamber of Commerce is a member of Eurochambres. Eurochambres is a co-operation body and network of European Chambers of Commerce and Industry.
memberOrga: 19 regional chambers of commerce in Finland.
goal:
Finland Chamber of Commerce promotes entrepreneurship and a favourable business environment in Finland and coordinates the operations of the nineteen independent regional Chambers of Commerce in Finland. The 19 Finnish Chambers of Commerce have more than 20,000 member companies.
Finland Chamber of Commerce ensures self-regulation in business; offers services related to, for example, dispute resolution, goods inspection and property valuation, and awards Medals of Merit.
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Customs, taxation,international trade, company law, securities market regulation, corporate governance, gender quotas, collective redress, consumer protection, IPR, digitalisation, taxation, environment, sustainable finance.
